body: Updating that this issue is still occurring with the latest Next.js `v15.6.0-canary.33`. I've put together a little repro here as well: https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/mutable-star-w6y3r8?workspaceId=ws_FFy8WZFGHmk9xkeVqwsT43 --- ✅ You'll see that if you run it with `next dev --webpack`, you get the expected result where only the capital letters use the font, due to it's `unicode-range` declaration: ❌ But if you run with `next dev --turbopack`, the `declarations` are not included, and this is the result: --- Importantly, this issue also exists with Turbopack for the `next build` command. This means we will be unable to use Turbopack for builds with the upcoming stabilisation, until this issue is fixed.

@GRA0007 and @joulev **How did you switch from turbopack to webpack?**  I'm also experiencing the same issue. NextJS App router, version 15.5.4. In my case the `descent-override` declaration is not making it into my bundled CSS (no declarations I've tried are working for that matter). I'm getting `error: unknown option '--webpack'` when changing the command from `next build --turbopack` to `next build --webpack`. Very frustrating indeed. I've wasted around 2 whole days so far trying to get such a simple font adjustment to work.

@qjstuart Ah, so the `--webpack` will only become an option when version 16.0.0 is released, that's why I was using it when testing the pre-release (canary version).

For version 15 and lower, you just have to leave off the `--turbopack` and it should build with webpack by default. In my experience, that fixes the font declarations, but if it's still not working for you, you may have a different issue.

issue.title: Turbopack: Implement next/font/local declarations option
issue.body:
## What?

Fixes #82822. Implements `declarations` which was missing in the implementation of `next/font/local`

Closes PACK-5711

body: I've opened a fix for Turbopack that implements this feature: #85051. It was missing.
This closed issue has been automatically locked because it had no new activity for 2 weeks. If you are running into a similar issue, please create a new issue with the steps to reproduce. Thank you.
